issues.title: Feature request: Allow repo owner to close and re-open issue and PR
issues.body: Waiting this issue to get closed :3

issues.title: Git Center Source repo disappeared from Repository Index
Feature request: allow embeding image in readme and comment
issues.body: Currently only text is shown when using `![image](image_url)` in readme and comment, like [you first comment here](/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/issues/view/?13zzNGxEXDeLxHEGZdG3mE7G8dChf45LrV/0@1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di)

issues.title: Unable to load file list
issues.body:
After the update from yesterday, [this subfolder](/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/?13zzNGxEXDeLxHEGZdG3mE7G8dChf45LrV/ZeroMeMastodonBridge@master) can't be loaded now. From the console:
```
URIError: malformed URI sequence  git.js:76:10
uncaught exception: File doesn't exist: merged-GitCenter/13zzNGxEXDeLxHEGZdG3mE7G8dChf45LrV/binchan-s-messy-repo.git/objects/89/2fdc106c30a38ab40aa67ece099a52e19bc1b6
```


And when I did the steps below:
1.    Create a new repo by cloning the default repo
2.    Clone my repo 13zzNGxEXDeLxHEGZdG3mE7G8dChf45LrV/binchan-s-messy-repo.git
3.    cd my repo clone, git remote add test new-repo.git, git push -f test master

File can't be loaded in the new repo, even for the root folder.

issues.title: Wrong id for the message "xxx added tag xxx ago"
issues.body: [Example](/gitcenter.bit/repo/issues/view/?15Z4H5K8YxjqGWpPxMLHWwr6Ve2nR7dz8d/1@1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h), the `needs-more-info` tag was added by `sayo@zeroid.bit`, but it displays my id instead.

issues.title: In one page I can't open readme
issues.body:
From [this page](/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/?13zzNGxEXDeLxHEGZdG3mE7G8dChf45LrV/ZeroMeMastodonBridge@master) in my repo (links that begin with `/` are all redirected...? Raw link: http://127.0.0.1:43110/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/?13zzNGxEXDeLxHEGZdG3mE7G8dChf45LrV/ZeroMeMastodonBridge@master

Firefox: `ReferenceError: link is not defined`

Chromium:
```
Uncaught (in promise) ReferenceError: link is not defined
Please report this to https://github.com/chjj/marked.
    at Renderer.renderer.image (repo.js:1287)
    at InlineLexer.outputLink (marked.js:708)
    at InlineLexer.output (marked.js:622)
    at Parser.tok (marked.js:1075)
    at Parser.parse (marked.js:935)
    at Function.Parser.parse (marked.js:922)
    at marked (marked.js:1219)
    at Repository.renderMarked (repo.js:1378)
    at repo.getFile.then.readme (main.js:141)
    at <anonymous>
```

issue_comments.body:
Doesn't work. Need to use the repo auth key instead of my ZeroID auth key.
> Failed to sign the content
> Private key invalid! Valid signers: [u'1Cy3ntkN2GN9MH6EaW6eHpi4YoRS2nK5Di', u'13zzNGxEXDeLxHEGZdG3mE7G8dChf45LrV'], Private key address: 1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h
With ZeroNet Rev3157 fix, my Pi 2 can load all repos now! The bug is really because `Could not decode a text frame as UTF-8.`. Oh man...
I see. I use remote server mode and my address begin with 192.168.1.110, but you are using absolute path 127.0.0.1. Could you change the related code from `127.0.0.1:43110/` to `/`.

After the update from yesterday, the subfolder [like this one](/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/?13zzNGxEXDeLxHEGZdG3mE7G8dChf45LrV/ZeroMeMastodonBridge@master) can't be loaded now.
From the console:
```
URIError: malformed URI sequence  git.js:76:10
uncaught exception: File doesn't exist: merged-GitCenter/13zzNGxEXDeLxHEGZdG3mE7G8dChf45LrV/binchan-s-messy-repo.git/objects/89/2fdc106c30a38ab40aa67ece099a52e19bc1b6
```


The error in the first line also occurs in the root folder but still files can be loaded.

Reproduce:
1. Create a new repo by cloning the default repo
2. Clone my repo `13zzNGxEXDeLxHEGZdG3mE7G8dChf45LrV/binchan-s-messy-repo.git`
3. `cd` my repo clone, `git remote add test new-repo.git`, `git push -f test master`
4. File can't be loaded in the new repo, even for the root folder.
After deleted and re-added Git Center, the problem is gone now. Look like there are some files failed to update and cause problems. Close the issue.
That's enough. Thx! Close the issue.
Need to use `wrapperInnerLoaded` and add id, link for every comment. [My related blog article](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/?Post:66)

pull_request_comments.body:
I can't load the commit above either... Could you sign and publish your repo again?
```
uncaught exception: File doesn't exist: merged-GitCenter/18r929Hq8hE5Pi9Zf7ovMQVyn3WcGfxMgu/gitcenter.git/objects/98/d42cfbdf40133f0c0cc55f56ec69131d570924
```

I think it's because you (and I) shut down ZeroNet too early after publishing the repo. A repo has hundreds of files, and there are still some files failed to publish to peers. I've submitted [a feature request to ZeroNet](/1GitLiXB6t5r8vuU2zC6a8GYj9ME6HMQ4t/repo/issues/view/?1P4w4Rvh4vS9r6G5xTiSh8qEW87EKZtnJB/0@1AWwhg4EiWAVttfQboJZ4wJfX3WawfJT3h) for displaying the amount of successfully published files when publishing site.

@gitcenter: Did you sign & publish your repo again? I cloned the repo, checked the log, deleted and re-added the repo, but the lastest commit is still `master`: `2e709e3be600baf185834b3265946a2dc9b57309`, `Wed Nov 29 11:17:36 2017 +0300 Update contributors`.

And I also checked [the repo on gitlab](https://gitlab.com/imachug/gitcenter/commit/98d42cfbdf40133f0c0cc55f56ec69131d570924), yep, the code is the same with my PR :)

pull_requests.title: Add repo name after the title in issue/PR newsfeed
pull_requests.body:
It's confusing that on ZeroHello all issues are from Git Center but don't point to a specific repo. I add ` | repo_name` to issue, if a repo isn't published to Repo index, it will be ` | Private Repo`.

Code for issues and PRs (it's should be the same for comments and actions, so I don't list them here):

`main/dist/js/repo.js`

```diff
INITIAL_FOLLOW_QUERIES = {
	"{object}s": "\
		SELECT\
			'{object}' AS type,\
			{object}s.date_added AS date_added,\
-			{object}s.title AS title,\
+			{object}s.title || ' | ' || COALESCE(repo_name, 'Private Repo') AS title,\
			{object}s.body AS body,\
			'repo/{url_object}s/view/?' || json.site || '/' || {object}s.id || '@' || REPLACE(json.directory, 'data/users/', '') AS url\
		FROM {object}s, json\
+		LEFT JOIN\
+			(\
+				SELECT address AS repo_address, title AS repo_name\
+				FROM repo_index\
+			) AS {object}s_repo\
+		ON (site = repo_address)\
		WHERE {object}s.json_id = json.json_id AND json.site IN (:params)\
	",
...
```
